title: Go Ethereum CLI Client always mines empty blocks
body:
Hi, I'm running the latest code on develop. If I send over a new contract via the RPC interface and then run a private chain (seed=false) The contract is received by the client and I can then send transactions to the contract which behave correctly, but the contract is never mined (nor are any of the other transactions sent to the contract) After a new block is mined, the contract appears to be wiped out and gone... If I disable mining on the other hand, the contract lives indefinitely and can be used indefinitely (but of course still remains unmined)

Below is my output. Note where it says "[XETH] Contract addr ..." when I send over the contract. However, it never appears any of the subsequent mined blocks, they all have zero transactions. In fact, I have NEVER seen a block with a transaction in the CLI ethereum client when I'm mining, at least on a solo chain. (I am using GAS=50000 and GASPRICE=5 to create the contract)

ethereum -seed=false -rpc -mine 
2015/02/26 19:29:11 [CHAIN] Last block (#4307) 98454392b6f08b69253e5d78d444fe2973dcee9e4e457d98b0874f19857f196a TD=641912077
